sentences.en: Affectation is inevitably the mark of one not sure of himself.
sentences.cn: 我从不认为不自然不简单的人是真正伟大的人.

sentences.en: Calling everyone ‘darling’ is just an affectation.
sentences.cn: 逢人就叫“亲爱的”很做作。

sentences.en: Enables the building to achieve nobly elegant, gives up affectation.
sentences.cn: 使建筑物达到高贵典雅, 返璞归真.

sentences.en: Give up all affectation . What is natural is best.
sentences.cn: 抛弃所有的做作吧,自然才是最好的.

sentences.en: He made an affectation of indifference.
sentences.cn: 他装出无动于衷的样子.

sentences.en: He raised his eyebrows with an affectation of surprise.
sentences.cn: 他扬起双眉装出一幅惊奇的样子.

sentences.en: He speaks with a British accent, but that is just an affectation because he's not British.
sentences.cn: 他说话带有英国口音, 但这是装出来的,因为他不是英国人.

sentences.en: He was an exceedingly genial soul , this young man, and wholly free of affectation.
sentences.cn: 他是个非常和气的人, 而且一点也不做作.

sentences.en: Her posh accent is pure affectation.
sentences.cn: 她的时髦腔调纯粹是矫揉造作.
我厌恶一切矫揉造作的行为.

sentences.en: I happen to enjoy my ghetto brew affectation.
sentences.cn: 我碰巧正沉浸在我的犹太人情感中.

sentences.en: I think he is sincere and quite without affectation.
sentences.cn: 我认为他为人诚挚,毫不做作.

sentences.en: I wore sunglasses all the time and people thought it was an affectation.
sentences.cn: 我成天戴着墨镜，大家都觉得我在装酷。

sentences.en: Lawson writes so well: in plain English, without fuss or affectation.
sentences.cn: 劳森写得很好：英文通俗易懂，朴实无华又不矫揉造作。

sentences.en: The way she speaks reeks of affectation.
What I advise him to do is ( to ) write without affectation.
sentences.cn: 我建议他做的就是不矫揉造作地写作.

words.tran_cn: 受到影响的；做作的；假装的
影响；假装；使…感动（affect的过去式和过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 假装，装模作样，装模作样的言行，矫情
trans.tran_en: If you say that someone's attitude or behaviour is an affectation, you disapprove of the fact that it is not genuine or natural, but is intended to impress other people
